Reviews.Content: very very average stay I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on the trip advisor which were not bad at all......but I was really disappointed with my decision of choosing this property. The room floor was filthy  the shower of the bathroom did not function properly....My husband requested them to change the room which they did but that was even worst!! The breakfast room is really small and the breakfast served was very average.....The only advantage was the hotel's close proximity to the station.....My sincere advise to all the travellers, pls think twice before getting this hotel booked.
Reviews.Author: shaziyabhatia

Reviews.Content: Hotel Golf - an unpleasant stay Our group of 5 stayed at the Hotel Golf in Florence, near the Termini. My daughter's room, # 107 I believe , had severe mosquito problems which the hotel staff failed to address. Instead they gave her a can of Raid (which made the room uninhabitable for several hours). It was obvious this was not a new problem since there were squished mosquitos all over the walls. We were very disappointed in the hotel's attitude - no compensation and no room change. My daughter had severe welts over her torso and limbs.
Reviews.Author: umoveit

Reviews.Content: Average hotel, needs attention. The hotel is ok. A 3 star basic hotel, no luxury what so ever. Clean, staff is fine, breakfast ok not the best I ve tried in Italy. a bit noisy even though double glazed windows. stayed on the 1st floor. The bathrooms are excellent! very new and nice. Not bad hotel if you are looking for sthing basic, not very close to the actual centre.
Reviews.Author: M_Escape_travel

Reviews.Content: not bad at all. Only five minutes from Florences train station, which was handy. Staff were pleasant enough, rooms clean, and huge buffet breakfast. Not bad at all. One piece of advice though, close the windows on a night, I came back home covered in mozzie bites!
Reviews.Author: rosiepickle

Reviews.Content: terrible stay Bed was so uncomfortable I slept on the floor - and my room was on the ground floor next to a parking lot with an automatic gate that screeched as it both openned and closed - each time someone left or returned to the hotel. Luckily I had only planned to stay one night and the shower was great, with enough hot water to wake me enough to catch my flight.
Reviews.Author: darkskyroad

Reviews.Content: Average hotel My husband and I stayed at Hotel Golf for 4 nights in October. The good stuff were the following:Clean room and bathroomParking for the car at the hotelVery nice staff in the evenings Good size roomRelatively close to the city centerThe bad things were:Not so serviceminded staff during the day or in the morningUncomfortable bedBoring breakfast, it consisted of bread, marmlade, butter, cheese, ham, yogurt, cererals. The coffee came from a machine. No warm alternatives.Our room faced the street which was very noisy
Reviews.Author: Tophondo

Reviews.Content: not too bad Location was a bit far from the main plaeces of interest. Room was very clean, nice mini bar, very good breakfasts. Would stay again
Reviews.Author: mtc10

Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff I stayed in Golf Hotel for a couple of nights. In general, it was a bit better than I expected. It was quite, clean enough, breakfast was of better quality and quantity compared to other 3-star hotels I visited the previous 10 days in Rome, Milan and Venice.But...the staff was superb. Really helpful, easygoing, funny, the advised me and Katerina where and how to go...couldn't have been more happy with them. And this hotel, was a last-minute booking since I was sent there by another hotel where I initially had booked. I would definitely visit the place again and also have a chat with the lads!Greg
Reviews.Author: Sagitarius

Reviews.Content: Low Budget Stay, Otherwise Stay Away On a budget travelling Italy, this hotel looked to be a good option. However, I have to admit it was the worst of all the stays along the way. It is a step above a Motel 6, but was in need of updating. Imagine taking a trip back to the early 70s...while cleaned, nothing has been updated. Staff was very friendly and helpful, but the rooms were outdated as if you were staying at your great grandma's house.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: It was OK It is funny how people can have different opinions about the same thing. I was actually really scared because of the reviews I had read and was therefore pleasantly surprised. Granted it is an old hotel. It is a small hotel. But from what I saw in Italy all the 3-star hotels are old and small. The breakfast was exactly what I had expected. Bread, spreads, and juices, they even included ham, cheese, and yogurt upon request.  The room was not the greatest, neither was the bathroom, but it was bigger than the hotel I had in Rome. The staff was fabulous. When my scheduled tour arrangements were mixed up they got right on the phone and made other arrangements for me. They were quite nice and helpful. Overall with its convenience to the train station, cleanliness, and ease to the City Center, I'd have to say I had a marvelous stay. And I would recommend this hotel to others.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else Spend a couple extra bucks and stay somewhere else.Imagine a run down hotel in the east end (or what ever part of your city is run down) and that sums up this hotel. The carpet in the hallway is stained and there is a unique smell walking to your room. We had a room on the first floor.We asked for a queen size bed and had two twins pushed together with queen size sheets put on top to make it look like a queen. It's deceiving until you get on the bed and start to fall through the middle. The TV was old and the reception was poor. Our remote wouldn't let you use the up/down channel button and the batteries were barely hanging in there by some tape. There is laminate in the rooms instead of old carpet which is the only thing in the room which is new (and probably really clean). Our phone did not work very well and when we asked to have it replaced, we were told to use the one in the lobby.They spent some money making the lobby and breakfast area more modern but that's as far as it goes.I did not feel safe in this area of Florence at night. Stay somewhere else closer to the main tourist area (close to the famous bridge). Our experience of Florence was tainted due to our memories of staying at Hotel Golf.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Disappointing Spent a total of 6 weeks in Europe staying at many different hotels. This would rate as the worst!!. Staff were rude and unhelpful!. Whatever you do, dont ask for room service..it will cost an arm and a leg and be of inferior quality. Rooms although clean are dank and very noisy should you get one on the roadside...even the double glass plus shuttered windows do not keep out the noise.Sheryl
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel at Great Price I am note sure what rooms this other folks stayed in, but this is a great hotel. Very, very clean. Nice bathrooms which must have been remodeled recently. You cannot open the windows, but we didn't stay in the room for long, so this wasn't a problem for us. Service was kind of abrubt, as it seems it was in most of Florence. We would stay there again, though.
Reviews.Author: UptownCat

Reviews.Content: Only if you are looking to save money This hotel needs some serious maintenance. The wallpaper was coming off, the bathroom looked really tired, the heating was so high I though I was in a sauna and what it is worst, the walls were paper thin so I could hear everything! For a second I thought someone was having a shower in my room! No joke. I'm a heavy sleeper and I had a hard time sleeping here. On top of that, they were doing some repairs and the hammering started at 8 am...I mean, if you own a hotel, be kind enough to leave the noise for after 10 am.The next morning I woke up and in the reception there were at least 70 kids from an excursion...Yes, you save money but I'm sure there are best deals in town.
Reviews.Author: Pat_newmarket

Reviews.Content: Alright. The most attractive part of this hotel was the free parking and the fact that it was close to the highway so when we drove in we did not have to deal too much with Florence traffic (which one must avoid at all costs!). The parking was also very safe as it was behind a locked gate. However the hotel did have some issues, the first of which was the rude desk man who was niether pleasant nor helpful. The rooms themselves were small, however because we were in Europe we could hardly complain about that. Our bathroom was actually very large. And the shower nice and hot with a real nonhand-held shower head!! (Far and few between in Europe!) The rooms were clean. But they were so very noisy. Besides the noises of other guests and slamming doors, a persistent hammering began at 8 am in the halls. Apparently this was the time that they saw best to start hotel construction. We were oh so pleased. Our friends had a room on the street-side of the building, and said that they felt like cars were actaully driving in their room. I will say that this hotel had better T.V. than any other in Europe, but who wants to watch T.V. in Florence? As well it was within walking distance to the main sites.
Reviews.Author: spooner1000
